titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania LJS 176: Traité de mecanique

msContents.summary: Treatise with references throughout to the large group of fold-out technical drawings that follow the text. Most of the machines are simple machines, such as levers, inclined planes, pulleys, wheels, and screws, but the last part of the manuscript is devoted to fluid dynamics.

msItem.title: Du mouvement des corps durs sans ressorts, f. 4v
Du mouvement des corps pesants, f. 7v
Des machines propres à communiquer..., f. 15r
Du mouvement des corps fluides, f. 39r

supportDesc.extent: 89 leaves : 255 x 172 (200 x 135) mm. bound to 263 x 186 mm., with fold-out drawings 255 x 342-356 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 89; [i-ii, 1], 2-57, [58-87], contemporary foliation in ink, upper right recto. The upper right corner of the leaf on which the text begins, which contained not only foliation but also a note, has been cut away (f. 1).

layoutDesc.layout: Text pages written in 18 long lines, with items of numbered lists sometimes marked in left margins.

decoDesc.decoNote: 27 plates of colored technical drawings that fold out to the right of blank paper the width of the manuscript, so as to be entirely visible alongside the text pages.

binding.p: Original calf, gilt spine with title Traite de mecan., ribbon marker.

history.provenance: Offered for sale at an earlier date by Laurence Witten, no. 15173.
Formerly owned by John D. Stanitz (Cleveland, Ohio), Ms. 7.
Acquired by Lawrence J. Schoenberg with other Stanitz manuscripts, Sept. 1997.
Deposit by Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle, 2012.
